sentence.Network_en: All this plethora of sight , and feeling, and thought occurred on the instant . There was no pause of the realities wherein he moved.
sentence.Network_cn: 尽管林林总总的形象 、 感觉 、 思想猛然袭来,在现实中他的行动却并未中断.

1. 一般观点general plethora 全身充血general polarity 普通极性

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in the medical sense): via late Latin from Greek plēthōrē, from plēthein 'be full'

entry.def: A plethora of something is a large amount of it, especially an amount of it that is greater than you need, want, or can cope with.

example.ex: A plethora of new operators will be allowed to enter the market.
example.tran: 大批新的运营商将获准进入该市场。
